actionId.description: id of the entity to lookup, eg: id of the tag being created, or id of the model object being updated

actionType.description: type of action that was performed, eg: diagram-content-update or model-object-create

includeActionsInContext.description: include actions from objects inside the context, eg: update of a model connection that is connected to a model object

action.description: full description of the action that happened

actionIds.description: id of the action and any related ids that were part of the action

importance.description: importance of the action log, eg: medium for tags created

parentId.description: parent action log id that caused this action to happen, eg: update of a diagram caused by a model object delete

actionType.description: type of action that was performed, eg: diagram-content-update or model-object-create

entityId.description: id of the entity to lookup, eg: id of the tag being created, or id of the model object being updated

performedById.description: id of the user or api key who performed the action

type.description: type of action that was performed, eg: diagram-content-update or model-object-create

description.description: Technical description for the technology, avoid marketing language

iconUrlDark.description: Icon that only works on dark backgrounds

iconUrlLight.description: Icon that only works on light backgrounds

nameShort.description: Short one or two word name to show in places with limited space

provider.description: Service provider that provides this technology

rejectionMessage.description: If rejected, detail description of why

restrictions.description: Restriction on which model object or connections this technology can be added to

status.description: Current status of the technology, including pending review, approved, and rejected. Approved technologies are visible to all users.

rejectionMessage.description: If rejected, detail description of why

status.description: Current status of the technology, including pending review, approved, and rejected. Approved technologies are visible to all users.

defaultSlug.description: URL path name for the technology, used by stackfeed

disabled.description: Whether the technology is disabled and not visible to users

organizationId.description: Organization that owns this technology, or null if its publicly accessible

slugs.description: Current and historical url path names used for the technology, used by stackfeed

description.description: Technical description for the technology

nameShort.description: Short name to show in places with limited space

brightness.description: Color brightness. Calculated based on the standard formula 0.2126R + 0.7152G + 0.0722*B

background.description: Indicates if the file has a transparent background.

height.description: Height of the logo in pixels

src.description: File source url of the logo

width.description: Width of the logo in pixels

formats.description: A list of format objects containing files in different formats

tags.description: A list of strings attached to the logo. For example, if the logo icon is "photographic" rather than a logomark.

theme.description: Theme of the logo. For example, "dark" or "light"

colors.description: Accent, dark, light & palette colors of the brand

isNsfw.description: true when the brand is for adult content, e.g. is not safe for work

logos.description: Logos, symbols & icons of the brand

empty.description: Filter diagrams that contain no objects

modelId.description: model object id this object belongs to

zoomOverrides.description: Custom zoom levels for specific model objects within the diagram. The key is the modelObjectId and the value is the diagram id.

diagramId.description: diagram id this flow belongs to

includeFlows.description: Whether or not to include flows in PDF exports, defaults to true

orientation.description: Orientation to use when exporting to PDF

UserNotificationsPartial.description: Subscribe the user to specific types of notifications

catalogTechnology.description: Subscribe to updates about catalog technology interactions

comments.description: Subscribe to comments, mentions, replies and resolutions

exports.description: Subscribe to PDF export completions or failures

invites.description: Subscribe to user invites to organizations

onboarding.description: Subscribe to user registration onboarding help and tips

UserNotifications.description: Subscribe the user to specific types of notifications

catalogTechnology.description: Subscribe to updates about catalog technology interactions

comments.description: Subscribe to comments, mentions, replies and resolutions

exports.description: Subscribe to PDF export completions or failures

invites.description: Subscribe to user invites to organizations

onboarding.description: Subscribe to user registration onboarding help and tips

BackstageAPI.description: An API describes an interface that can be exposed by a component. The API can be defined in different formats, like OpenAPI, AsyncAPI, GraphQL, gRPC, or other formats.

relations.description: The relations that this entity has with other entities.

type.description: The type of the API definition.

lifecycle.description: The lifecycle state of the API.

owner.description: An entity reference to the owner of the API.

system.description: An entity reference to the system that the API belongs to.

definition.description: The definition of the API, based on the format defined by the type.

BackstageComponent.description: A Component describes a software component. It is typically intimately linked to the source code that constitutes the component, and should be what a developer may regard a "unit of software", usually with a distinct deployable or linkable artifact.

relations.description: The relations that this entity has with other entities.

lifecycle.description: The lifecycle state of the component.

owner.description: An entity reference to the owner of the component.

system.description: An entity reference to the system that the component belongs to.

subcomponentOf.description: An entity reference to another component of which the component is a part.

providesApis.description: An array of entity references to the APIs that are provided by the component.

consumesApis.description: An array of entity references to the APIs that are consumed by the component.

dependsOn.description: An array of references to other entities that the component depends on to function.

BackstageDomain.description: A Domain groups a collection of systems that share terminology, domain models, business purpose, or documentation, i.e. form a bounded context.

relations.description: The relations that this entity has with other entities.

owner.description: An entity reference to the owner of the component.

BackstageEntity.description: The parts of the format that's common to all versions/kinds of entity.

BackstageEntityMap.description: The parts of the format that's common to all versions/kinds of entity.

BackstageEntityMeta.description: Metadata fields common to all versions/kinds of entity.

uid.description: A globally unique ID for the entity. This field can not be set by the user at creation time, and the server will reject an attempt to do so. The field will be populated in read operations. The field can (optionally) be specified when performing update or delete operations, but the server is free to reject requests that do so in such a way that it breaks semantics.

etag.description: An opaque string that changes for each update operation to any part of the entity, including metadata. This field can not be set by the user at creation time, and the server will reject an attempt to do so. The field will be populated in read operations. The field can (optionally) be specified when performing update or delete operations, and the server will then reject the operation if it does not match the current stored value.

name.description: The name of the entity. Must be unique within the catalog at any given point in time, for any given namespace + kind pair.

namespace.description: The namespace that the entity belongs to.

title.description: A display name of the entity, to be presented in user interfaces instead of the name property, when available.

description.description: A short (typically relatively few words, on one line) description of the entity.

labels.description: Key/value pairs of identifying information attached to the entity.

annotations.description: Key/value pairs of non-identifying auxiliary information attached to the entity.

tags.description: A list of single-valued strings, to for example classify catalog entities in various ways.

links.description: A list of external hyperlinks related to the entity. Links can provide additional contextual information that may be located outside of Backstage itself. For example, an admin dashboard or external CMS page.

url.description: A url in a standard uri format.

title.description: A user friendly display name for the link.

icon.description: A key representing a visual icon to be displayed in the UI.

type.description: An optional value to categorize links into specific groups.

name.description: The type name of the error

code.description: An error code associated with the error

BackstageGroup.description: A group describes an organizational entity, such as for example a team, a business unit, or a loose collection of people in an interest group. Members of these groups are modeled in the catalog as kind User.

relations.description: The relations that this entity has with other entities.

type.description: The type of group. There is currently no enforced set of values for this field, so it is left up to the adopting organization to choose a nomenclature that matches their org hierarchy.

profile.description: Optional profile information about the group, mainly for display purposes. All fields of this structure are also optional. The email would be a group email of some form, that the group may wish to be used for contacting them. The picture is expected to be a URL pointing to an image that's representative of the group, and that a browser could fetch and render on a group page or similar.

displayName.description: A simple display name to present to users.

email.description: An email where this entity can be reached.

picture.description: The URL of an image that represents this entity.

parent.description: The immediate parent group in the hierarchy, if any. Not all groups must have a parent; the catalog supports multi-root hierarchies. Groups may however not have more than one parent. This field is an entity reference.

children.description: The immediate child groups of this group in the hierarchy (whose parent field points to this group). The list must be present, but may be empty if there are no child groups. The items are not guaranteed to be ordered in any particular way. The entries of this array are entity references.

members.description: The users that are members of this group. The entries of this array are entity references.

BackstageLocation.description: A location is a marker that references other places to look for catalog data.

relations.description: The relations that this entity has with other entities.

type.description: The single location type, that's common to the targets specified in the spec. If it is left out, it is inherited from the location type that originally read the entity data.

target.description: A single target as a string. Can be either an absolute path/URL (depending on the type), or a relative path such as ./details/catalog-info.yaml which is resolved relative to the location of this Location entity itself.

targets.description: A list of targets as strings. They can all be either absolute paths/URLs (depending on the type), or relative paths such as ./details/catalog-info.yaml which are resolved relative to the location of this Location entity itself.

presence.description: Whether the presence of the location target is required and it should be considered an error if it can not be found

BackstageReference.description: A reference by name to another entity.

kind.description: The kind field of the entity.

namespace.description: The metadata.namespace field of the entity.

name.description: The metadata.name field of the entity.

BackstageRelation.description: A directed relation from one entity to another.

targetRef.description: The entity ref of the target of this relation.

BackstageResource.description: A resource describes the infrastructure a system needs to operate, like BigTable databases, Pub/Sub topics, S3 buckets or CDNs. Modelling them together with components and systems allows to visualize resource footprint, and create tooling around them.

relations.description: The relations that this entity has with other entities.

owner.description: An entity reference to the owner of the resource.

dependsOn.description: An array of references to other entities that the resource depends on to function.

system.description: An entity reference to the system that the resource belongs to.

BackstageStatus.description: The current status of the entity, as claimed by various sources.

BackstageStatusItem.description: A specific status item on a well known format.

level.description: The status level / severity of the status item.

message.description: A brief message describing the status, intended for human consumption.

error.description: An optional serialized error object related to the status.

BackstageSystem.description: A system is a collection of resources and components. The system may expose or consume one or several APIs. It is viewed as abstraction level that provides potential consumers insights into exposed features without needing a too detailed view into the details of all components. This also gives the owning team the possibility to decide about published artifacts and APIs.

metadata.name: artist-engagement-portal
metadata.description: Handy tools to keep artists in the loop

relations.description: The relations that this entity has with other entities.

owner.description: An entity reference to the owner of the component.

domain.description: An entity reference to the domain that the system belongs to.

description.description: Descriptive name for the flow step

detailedDescription.description: Long description for the flow step

order.description: The order of this animation step.

elements.description: The set of element IDs that should be included in this animation step.

relationships.description: The set of relationship IDs that should be included in this animation step.

success.description: true if the API call was successful, false otherwise.

StructurizrAutomaticLayout.description: Represents the auto-layout configuration for a given view.

nodeSeparation.description: The separation between nodes in the same rank (pixels).

vertices.description: Whether vertices should be created during automatic layout.

StructurizrBranding.description: A wrapper for the font and logo for diagram/documentation branding purposes.

logo.description: A Base64 data URI representation of a PNG/JPG/GIF file.

font.description: Represents a font, including a name and an optional URL for web fonts.

name.description: The font name (e.g. "Times New Roman", "Open Sans", etc).

url.description: For web fonts, the URL where the font can be found.

key.description: A unique identifier for this view.

order.description: An integer representing the creation order of this view.

description.description: The description of this view.

properties.description: A set of arbitrary name-value properties.

containerId.description: The ID of the container this view is associated with.

paperSize.description: The paper size that should be used to render this view.

elements.description: The set of elements in this views.

relationships.description: The set of relationships in this views.

externalContainerBoundariesVisible.description: Specifies whether container boundaries should be visible for "external" components (those outside the container in scope).

StructurizrComponent.description: A component (a grouping of related functionality behind an interface that runs inside a container).

id.description: The ID of this component in the model.

description.description: A short description of this component.

technology.description: The technology associated with this component (e.g. Spring Bean).

tags.description: A comma separated list of tags associated with this component.

url.description: The URL where more information about this element can be found.

group.description: The name of the group in which this component should be included in.

properties.description: A set of arbitrary name-value properties.

perspectives.description: The set of perspectives associated with this element.

relationships.description: The set of relationships from this component to other elements.

key.description: A unique identifier for this view.

order.description: An integer representing the creation order of this view.

description.description: The description of this view.

properties.description: A set of arbitrary name-value properties.

containerId.description: The ID of the container this view is associated with.

paperSize.description: The paper size that should be used to render this view.

elements.description: The set of elements in this views.

relationships.description: The set of relationships in this views.

externalContainerBoundariesVisible.description: Specifies whether container boundaries should be visible for "external" components (those outside the container in scope).

StructurizrConfiguration.description: The configuration associated with a set of views.

styles.description: The styles associated with this set of views.

lastSavedView.description: The key of the view that was saved most recently.

defaultView.description: The key of the view that should be shown by default.

themes.description: The URL(s) of the theme(s) to be used when rendering diagrams.

metadataSymbols.description: The type of symbols to use when rendering metadata.

properties.description: A set of arbitrary name-value properties.

StructurizrContainer.description: A container (something that can execute code or host data).

id.description: The ID of this container in the model.

description.description: A short description of this container.

technology.description: The technology associated with this container (e.g. Apache Tomcat).

tags.description: A comma separated list of tags associated with this container.

url.description: The URL where more information about this element can be found.

components.description: The set of components within this container.

group.description: The name of the group in which this container should be included in.

properties.description: A set of arbitrary name-value properties.

perspectives.description: The set of perspectives associated with this element.

relationships.description: The set of relationships from this container to other elements.

StructurizrContainerInstance.description: An instance of a container, running on a deployment node.

id.description: The ID of this container instance in the model.

containerId.description: The ID of the container this is an instance of.

environment.description: The deployment environment in which this container instance resides (e.g. "Development", "Live", etc).

tags.description: A comma separated list of tags associated with this container instance.

properties.description: A set of arbitrary name-value properties.

perspectives.description: The set of perspectives associated with this element.

relationships.description: The set of relationships from this container instance to other elements.

healthChecks.description: The set of HTTP-based health checks for this container instance.

key.description: A unique identifier for this view.

order.description: An integer representing the creation order of this view.

description.description: The description of this view.

properties.description: A set of arbitrary name-value properties.

softwareSystemId.description: The ID of the software system this view is associated with.

paperSize.description: The paper size that should be used to render this view.

elements.description: The set of elements in this views.

relationships.description: The set of relationships in this views.

externalSoftwareSystemBoundariesVisible.description: Specifies whether software system boundaries should be visible for "external" containers (those outside the software system in scope).

StructurizrDecision.description: A decision record (e.g. architecture decision record).

date.description: The date that the decision was made (ISO 8601 format).

content.description: The Markdown or AsciiDoc content of the section.

elementId.description: The ID of the element (in the model) that this decision applies to (optional).

id.description: The ID of this deployment node in the model.

name.description: The name of this deployment node.

description.description: A short description of this deployment node.

technology.description: The technology associated with this deployment node (e.g. Apache Tomcat).

environment.description: The deployment environment in which this deployment node resides (e.g. "Development", "Live", etc).

instances.description: The number of instances; either a number (e.g. 1, 2, etc) or a range (e.g. 0..N, 0..*, 1..3, etc).

tags.description: A comma separated list of tags associated with this deployment node.

url.description: The URL where more information about this element can be found.

children.description: The set of child/nested deployment nodes.

softwareSystemInstances.description: The set of software systems instances running in this deployment node..

containerInstances.description: The set of container instances running in this deployment node..

properties.description: A set of arbitrary name-value properties.

perspectives.description: The set of perspectives associated with this element.

relationships.description: The set of relationships from this deployment node to other elements.

key.description: A unique identifier for this view.

order.description: An integer representing the creation order of this view.

description.description: The description of this view.

properties.description: A set of arbitrary name-value properties.

softwareSystemId.description: The ID of the software system this view is associated with (optional).

environment.description: The name of the environment that this deployment view is for (e.g. "Development", "Live", etc).

paperSize.description: The paper size that should be used to render this view.

elements.description: The set of elements in this views.

relationships.description: The set of relationships in this views.

StructurizrDimensions.description: Represents a width and height pair.

content.description: The Markdown or AsciiDoc content of the section.

order.description: The order (index) of the section in the document.

key.description: A unique identifier for this view.

order.description: An integer representing the creation order of this view.

description.description: The description of this view.

properties.description: A set of arbitrary name-value properties.

elementId.description: The ID of the element this view is associated with (optional).

paperSize.description: The paper size that should be used to render this view.

elements.description: The set of elements in this views.

relationships.description: The set of relationships in this views.

externalBoundariesVisible.description: Specifies software system/container boundaries should be visible for "external" containers/components (those outside the element in scope)

StructurizrElementStyle.description: A definition of an element style.

tag.description: The tag to which this element style applies.

width.description: The width of the element, in pixels.

height.description: The height of the element, in pixels.

background.description: The background colour of the element, as a HTML RGB hex string (e.g. '#ffffff').

stroke.description: The stroke colour of the element, as a HTML RGB hex string (e.g. '#000000').

strokeWidth.description: The width of the stroke, in pixels.

color.description: The foreground (text) colour of the element, as a HTML RGB hex string (e.g. '#ffffff').

fontSize.description: The standard font size used to render text, in pixels.

shape.description: The shape used to render the element.

icon.description: A Base64 data URI representation of a PNG/JPG/GIF file.

border.description: The type of border used to render the element.

opacity.description: The opacity used when rendering the element; 0-100.

metadata.description: Whether the element metadata should be shown or not.

description.description: Whether the element description should be shown or not.

StructurizrElementView.description: An instance of a model element (Person, Software System, Container or Component) in a View.

x.description: The horizontal position of the element when rendered.

y.description: The vertical position of the element when rendered.

StructurizrFilteredView.description: Represents a view on top of a view, which can be used to include or exclude specific elements.

key.description: A unique identifier for this view.

order.description: An integer representing the creation order of this view.

description.description: The description of this view.

properties.description: A set of arbitrary name-value properties.

baseViewKey.description: The key of the view on which this filtered view is based.

mode.description: Whether elements/relationships are being included or excluded based upon the set of tags.

tags.description: The set of tags to include/exclude elements/relationships when rendering this filtered view.

StructurizrHttpHealthCheck.description: Describes a HTTP based health check.

name.description: The name of the health check.

timeout.description: The timeout after which a health check is deemed as failed, in milliseconds.

headers.description: A set of name-value pairs corresponding to HTTP headers that should be sent with the request.

content.description: The (base64 encoded) content of the image.

StructurizrImageView.description: A view that has been rendered elsewhere (e.g. PlantUML, Mermaid, Kroki, etc) as a image (e.g. PNG).

key.description: A unique identifier for this view.

order.description: An integer representing the creation order of this view.

description.description: The description of this view.

properties.description: A set of arbitrary name-value properties.

elementId.description: The ID of the element this view is associated with (optional).

content.description: The content of this image view, which needs to be a URL or a data URI.

contentType.description: The content type of this view (e.g. "image/png").

id.description: The ID of this infrastructure node in the model.

name.description: The name of this infrastructure node.

description.description: A short description of this infrastructure node.

technology.description: The technology associated with this infrastructure node (e.g. "Route 53").

environment.description: The deployment environment in which this infrastructure node resides (e.g. "Development", "Live", etc).

tags.description: A comma separated list of tags associated with this infrastructure node.

url.description: The URL where more information about this element can be found.

properties.description: A set of arbitrary name-value properties.

perspectives.description: The set of perspectives associated with this element.

relationships.description: The set of relationships from this infrastructure node to other elements.

enterprise.description: The enterprise associated with this model.

properties.description: A set of arbitrary name-value properties.

StructurizrPerson.description: A person who uses a software system.

id.description: The ID of this person in the model.

description.description: A short description of this person.

tags.description: A comma separated list of tags associated with this person.

url.description: The URL where more information about this element can be found.

group.description: The name of the group in which this person should be included in.

properties.description: A set of arbitrary name-value properties.

perspectives.description: The set of perspectives associated with this element.

relationships.description: The set of relationships from this person to other elements.

StructurizrPerspective.description: Represents an architectural perspective, that can be applied to elements and relationships.

description.description: The description of this perspective.

id.description: The ID of this relationship in the model.

description.description: A short description of this relationship.

tags.description: A comma separated list of tags associated with this relationship.

url.description: The URL where more information about this relationship can be found.

properties.description: A set of arbitrary name-value properties.

perspectives.description: The set of perspectives associated with this relationship.

sourceId.description: The ID of the source element.

destinationId.description: The ID of the destination element.

technology.description: The technology associated with this relationship (e.g. HTTPS, JDBC, etc).

linkedRelationshipId.description: The ID of the container-container relationship upon which this container instance-container instance relationship is based.

StructurizrRelationshipStyle.description: A definition of a relationship style.

tag.description: The tag to which this relationship style applies.

thickness.description: The thickness of the line, in pixels.

color.description: The colour of the line, as a HTML RGB hex string (e.g. '#ffffff').

fontSize.description: The standard font size used to render the relationship annotation, in pixels.

width.description: The width of the relationship annotation, in pixels.

dashed.description: A flag to indicate whether the line is rendered as dashed or not.

routing.description: The routing algorithm used when rendering lines.

position.description: The position of the annotation along the line; 0 (start) to 100 (end).

opacity.description: The opacity used when rendering the line; 0-100.

StructurizrRelationshipView.description: An instance of a model relationship in a View.

description.description: The description of this relationship (used in dynamic views only).

response.description: Signifies whether this relationship represents a return/response message (used in dynamic views only).

order.description: Gets the order of this relationship (used in dynamic views only; e.g. 1.0, 1.1, 2.0, etc).

vertices.description: The set of vertices used to render the relationship.

routing.description: The routing algorithm used when rendering this individual relationship.

position.description: The position of the annotation along the line; 0 (start) to 100 (end).

id.description: The ID of this software system in the model.

name.description: The name of this software system.

description.description: A short description of this software system.

location.description: The location of this software system.

tags.description: A comma separated list of tags associated with this software system.

url.description: The URL where more information about this element can be found.

containers.description: The set of containers within this software system.

group.description: The name of the group in which this software system should be included in.

properties.description: A set of arbitrary name-value properties.

perspectives.description: The set of perspectives associated with this element.

relationships.description: The set of relationships from this software system to other elements.

StructurizrSoftwareSystemInstance.description: An instance of a software system, running on a deployment node.

id.description: The ID of this software system instance in the model.

softwareSystemId.description: The ID of the software system this is an instance of.

environment.description: The deployment environment in which this software system instance resides (e.g. "Development", "Live", etc).

tags.description: A comma separated list of tags associated with this software system instance.

properties.description: A set of arbitrary name-value properties.

perspectives.description: The set of perspectives associated with this element.

relationships.description: The set of relationships from this software system instance to other elements.

healthChecks.description: The set of HTTP-based health checks for this software system instance.

key.description: A unique identifier for this view.

order.description: An integer representing the creation order of this view.

description.description: The description of this view.

properties.description: A set of arbitrary name-value properties.

softwareSystemId.description: The ID of the software system this view is associated with.

paperSize.description: The paper size that should be used to render this view.

enterpriseBoundaryVisible.description: Specifies whether the enterprise boundary (to differentiate internal elements from external elements") should be visible on the resulting diagram.

elements.description: The set of elements in this view.

relationships.description: The set of relationships in this view.

key.description: A unique identifier for this view.

order.description: An integer representing the creation order of this view.

description.description: The description of this view.

properties.description: A set of arbitrary name-value properties.

paperSize.description: The paper size that should be used to render this view.

enterpriseBoundaryVisible.description: Specifies whether the enterprise boundary (to differentiate internal elements from external elements) should be visible on the resulting diagram.

elements.description: The set of elements in this views.

relationships.description: The set of relationships in this views.

StructurizrTerminology.description: Provides a way for the terminology on diagrams, etc to be modified (e.g. language translations).

enterprise.description: The terminology used when rendering the enterprise boundary.

person.description: The terminology used when rendering people.

softwareSystem.description: The terminology used when rendering software systems.

container.description: The terminology used when rendering containers.

component.description: The terminology used when rendering components.

code.description: The terminology used when rendering code elements.

deploymentNode.description: The terminology used when rendering deployment nodes.

relationship.description: The terminology used when rendering relationships.

StructurizrUser.description: Represents a user who should have access to a workspace.

username.description: The username of the user (e.g. e-mail address).

StructurizrVertex.description: The X, Y coordinate of a bend in a line.

x.description: The horizontal position of the vertex when rendered.

y.description: The vertical position of the vertex when rendered.

StructurizrViews.description: The set of views onto a software architecture model.

systemLandscapeViews.description: The set of system landscape views.

systemContextViews.description: The set of system context views.

StructurizrWorkspace.description: Represents a Structurizr workspace, which is a wrapper for a software architecture model, views, and documentation.

description.description: A short description of the workspace.

version.description: A version number for the workspace.

thumbnail.description: The thumbnail associated with the workspace; a Base64 encoded PNG file as a data URI (data:image/png;base64).

lastModifiedDate.description: The last modified date, in ISO 8601 format (e.g. "2018-09-08T12:40:03Z").

lastModifiedUser.description: A string identifying the user who last modified the workspace (e.g. an e-mail address or username).

lastModifiedAgent.description: A string identifying the agent that was last used to modify the workspace (e.g. "structurizr-java/1.2.0").

properties.description: A set of arbitrary name-value properties.

StructurizrWorkspaceConfiguration.description: The workspace configuration (for Structurizr cloud service and on-premises installation).

scope.description: The scope of the workspace (can be unset for unscoped).
